cleaned.title: [ARC] Increase Supply Cap of sUSD on v3 Optimism to 20m (Fast-track)
cleaned.author: 0x46abFE1C972fCa43766d6aD70E1c1Df72F4Bb4d1

raw.title: [ARC] Increase Supply Cap of sUSD on v3 Optimism to 20m (Fast-track)
raw.author: 0x46abFE1C972fCa43766d6aD70E1c1Df72F4Bb4d1
raw.body:
Current parameters:

Supply cap: 10M sUSD → 20m sUSD (proposed increase of supply cap)

DEX Liquidity: ~$50m+

Normal mode:

LTV: 60%

Liquidation threshold: 75%

Liquidation penalty: 5%

E-mode:

Assets: Stablecoins

Max LTV: 97%

Proposal: Increase of supply cap by 100% to 20m sUSD

The current sUSD supply cap on v3 is 10m sUSD and has been reached shortly after the launch of AAVE and Optimisms liquidity mining program on AAVE V3.

The proposal’s goal is to suggest an increase of 100% to 20m sUSD supply cap via the fast-track process as outlined here

Reasons for increase:

sUSD Dex Liquidity: Despite market conditions, sUSD DEX liquidity vastly increased across Optimism on Curve, Uniswap, Velodrome, and others. This can facilitate healthy liquidations if ever necessary.

sUSD’s Healthy Peg: Throughout the entire time sUSD has been an asset on AAVE, it has held peg and has not decreased within 1% of the expected peg of $1. This is due to increased sUSD Dex liquidity, and constant arbitrage of the peg by market makers.

Optimism Liquidity Mining: Due to the ongoing OP liquidity mining program on AAVE V3, the sUSD supply cap has been hit very quickly. To ensure that more users are able to supply/borrow on AAVE, it is important to increase this supply cap to ensure that there is ample amounts of sUSD available on AAVE.

We look forward to the discussion on increasing the Supply Cap of sUSD on v3 by 100% to 20m sUSD.

Note: We’ve used the template set by sAVAX when they’ve increased their supply cap via Fast-Track as well.

choices: Leave sUSD Supply Cap as is

cleaned.title: [ARC] Increase Supply Cap of sUSD on v3 Optimism to 35m (Fast-track)
cleaned.author: 0x46abFE1C972fCa43766d6aD70E1c1Df72F4Bb4d1

raw.title: [ARC] Increase Supply Cap of sUSD on v3 Optimism to 35m (Fast-track)
raw.author: 0x46abFE1C972fCa43766d6aD70E1c1Df72F4Bb4d1
raw.body:
Current parameters:

Supply cap: 20M sUSD → 35m sUSD (proposed increase of supply cap)

DEX Liquidity: ~$50m+

Normal mode:

LTV: 60%

Liquidation threshold: 75%

Liquidation penalty: 5%

E-mode:

Assets: Stablecoins

Max LTV: 97%

Proposal: Increase of supply cap by 75% to 35m sUSD

The current sUSD supply cap on v3 is 20m sUSD and may be reached as the market is already ~70% full. To ensure that this cap isn’t hit and supply rates drastically increase, it is crucial to increase the cap before then.

The proposal’s goal is to suggest an increase of 75% to 35m sUSD supply cap via the fast-track process as outlined here

Reasons for increase:

sUSD Dex Liquidity: Despite market conditions, sUSD DEX liquidity vastly increased across Optimism on Curve, Uniswap, Velodrome, and others. This can facilitate healthy liquidations if ever necessary.

sUSD’s Healthy Peg: Throughout the entire time sUSD has been an asset on AAVE, it has held peg and has not decreased within 1% of the expected peg of $1. This is due to increased sUSD Dex liquidity, and constant arbitrage of the peg by market makers.

Optimism Liquidity Mining: Due to the ongoing OP liquidity mining program on AAVE V3, the sUSD supply cap has been hit very quickly. To ensure that more users are able to supply/borrow on AAVE, it is important to increase this supply cap to ensure that there is ample amounts of sUSD available on AAVE.

Note: We’ve used the template set by sAVAX when they’ve increased their supply cap via Fast-Track as well and have used the prior increase for sUSD as a template.

decision.summary: The proposal recommends initial supply caps for currently uncapped assets across Avalanche, Optimism, and Arbitrum chains, based on detailed market, liquidity, and risk considerations. Voting timeline and forum discussions strongly support the conservative risk management approach.
key_arguments_for: Proposal provides prudent initial supply caps reflecting market conditions and asset liquidity.
Voting timeline shows unanimous and stable support for the 'YAE' choice.
Forum discussions recognize the proposal as a necessary conservative risk management step.
Similar past proposals with conservative caps have been successfully adopted without major negative market consequences.
key_arguments_against: Some forum comments question liquidity data and seek more detailed explanations.
Concerns about discrepancies in liquidation penalties and thresholds for certain assets.
Potential impact on liquidity and utilization due to conservative caps, though considered manageable.

evidence.reference: Forum discussion on supply cap recommendations
evidence.quote: The objective of this proposal by Chaos Labs is to recommend supply caps for v3 assets that are currently uncapped... These conservative initial supply caps appear to be aligned with current market conditions.
Lead ratio total and stability metrics show unanimous support for 'YAE' with early voting dominance.
Similar proposal recommended conservative risk management supply caps with successful adoption.

decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'YAE' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
• The voting timeline analysis indicates unanimous and stable support for the 'YAE' option, with all quartiles favoring it and early voting dominance, reflecting a clear and stable community preference.
• Forum sentiment is generally neutral to positive, with key community members acknowledging the prudence of conservative supply caps aligned with market conditions, supporting the vote outcome.
• Historical lessons from a similar adjacent proposal show that conservative supply caps and risk management are prudent and have been successfully implemented, avoiding negative market impacts.
• Market impact metrics show modest positive token price movement and slight TVL decline, which do not contradict the prudence of the proposal.
• Overall, the recommendation to 'Change' by adopting these supply caps aligns with both the community sentiment and voting dynamics, promoting the long-term health and risk management of the protocol.
